com.bretth.osmosis.core.pipeline.common
Class TaskManagerFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.bretth.osmosis.core.pipeline.common.TaskManagerFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoundingBoxFilterFactory, ChangeApplierFactory, ChangeBufferFactory, ChangeDeriverFactory, ChangeMergerFactory, ChangeProgressLoggerFactory, ChangeSorterFactory, ChangeTeeFactory, DatabaseTaskManagerFactory, EntityBufferFactory, EntityMergerFactory, EntityProgressLoggerFactory, EntityReporterFactory, EntitySorterFactory, EntityTeeFactory, IntegrityReporterFactory, NullChangeWriterFactory, NullWriterFactory, PolygonFilterFactory, XmlDownloaderFactory, XmlTaskManagerFactory
public abstract class TaskManagerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

All task implementations require a corresponding task manager factory. This task manager factory is responsible for instantiating a task based upon command line arguments, and instantiating a task manager to manage the task within a pipeline. The factories are singleton instances registered globally and re-used for every task to be created.

Author:
Brett Henderson

createTaskManager

public static TaskManager createTaskManager(java.lang.String taskType,
                                            java.lang.String taskId,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> taskArgs,
                                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> pipeArgs)
Create a new task manager containing a task instance.

Parameters:
taskType - The identifier for the task type.
taskId - The unique identifier for this task instance.
taskArgs - The arguments used for initialising the task instance.
pipeArgs - The arguments used for connecting the task inputs and outputs.
Returns:
The newly created task manager.
